dict.string: You do something generic.\nYou go on to do more generic things.

You are tempted by all of the power you could wield, but resist. After all, you've gotten this far without hurting a single thing.\nInstead, you register yourself as a crewmember of the vessel, and live live a peaceful life with the vessel's resources.

You don't really have the knowledge to activate the vessel, but you can recognize good loot when you see it./nSeveral weeks later, you return home with the juiciest relics you could find, and gain a great fortune.

You could use the power of this vessel to cause great damage, or to amass wealth, but something like that would be wrong./nInstead, you activate the vessel so you can use it to stop wars and bring peace to the world. Maybe it'll even work.
With your knowledge of Eol relics, you are able to reactivate the vessel.\nYou use it's power to carve out your own empire.
With your heretical knowledge, you are able to fully reactivate the vessel.\nYou use it's weapons to strike against the Highborn, in the hopes of freeing humanity.
Try as you might, you cannot figure out how to operate the vessel.\nYou return home in shame. At least you retrieved some valuable items.
The Eols will never welcome you back, with the things you know.\nInstead, you use your heretical knowledge to fully reactivate the vessel and use it's weapons for power.
You reactivate the vessel, and return it home.\NYour Eol brethren welcome you home with open arms, inspired by your devotion.
You reactivate the vessel, and return it home.\NYour Eol brethren are wary, having heard of how you killed those zealots, but in the end they welcome you back.
You know that the Eol will not forgive you for your actions.\NYou reactivate the vessel and instead give it to the Humans. Hopefully they will know what to do with it.
You have proven your strength, and you return home.\nYour old superior welcomes you back, and gives you back your family armor.
You might not have your honor back, but you do have the knowledge to reactivate the vessel.\nYou use it's power to become a rich mercenary.

You have proven your strength, but the Raiders will not welcome you back after you killed one of them.\nYou loot what weapons you can find in the control room, and use them to become a successful mercenary.
You could use this power of this vessel to hurt people, or to win wars, but that would be wrong.\nInstead, you activate the vessel and use it to help people. It is a treasure all must benefit from.
After having held back the Highborn expedition, you know you can never return.\nYou instead use the power of the vessel to amass a great fortune, and live a life of pleasure.
You activate the vessel and return it to the Highborn.\nThey apologize for exiling you, and shower you with fame and fortune beyond your wildest dreams.
Most people would not know how to activate the vessel's weapons, but you have the heretical knowledge required.\nYou use the vessel to carve out a new empire, one which will worship you as a god.
